briefdescription.para: Data arrays for each of the attributes.
Attribute names of the saved data.
Task that periodically exposes the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *port, int max_attributes, int cache_size, int max_selected, const char *in_port, int in_addr, int queue_size, int blocking_callbacks, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: NDPluginAttrPlot

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of Y1 attributes to save.
Size of the cache for an attribute.
Maximum number of selected Y1 attributes.
Port from where the NDArrays are recieved.
Address from where the NDArrays are recieved.
Size of the NDArray callback queue.
Stack size for the internal thread.

briefdescription.para: Caches the values of attributes in the array.

detaileddescription.para: Also resets the driver if the UID of the NDArray is lower than the last cached one.

briefdescription.para: Called when an OUT record with asynInt32 interface is processed.

parameterdescription.para: Structure that encodes the reason and address.

briefdescription.para: Repopulates the attributes from the attribute list.

detaileddescription.para: The new attribute names vector is ordered and contains at most max_attributes attribute names.
This also updates the selected fields so that if attributes were selected before the rebuild they are also selected after the rebuild.

parameterdescription.para: Attribute list from where the attributes are read.

briefdescription.para: Clears all the data from the cache and reinitializes the plugin.
Sets data from the attribute list to the cache.
Exposes the selected data fields to EPICS layer.
Exposes the attribute names to the EPICS layer.
Exposes the selection status of attributes to the EPICS layer.
AD plugin that saves attribute values from recieved NDArrays.

detaileddescription.para: The plugin caches last attributes values in and exposes the selected ones periodically to the EPICS layer in waveform records. The plugin only works with numerical Attributes. The type of the attribute is discarded, all attributes are interpreted as doubles.

The attributes are read from the NDArray on the first frame of acquisition and populated in first come first served fashion (unpredictable order). On reset or reacquistion the cache is cleared and all data is discarded.
